entry.title: Create Lead from SMC to C4C: add custom field
entry.content:
Hi,

I have a campaign flow, where data comes in from a SAP Marketing Cloud Form, and a trigger-based campaign is creating a lead in C4C.

I would now like to improve this flow as follows:

If the form was filled in by an existing customer (aka the Origin SAP_C4C_BUPA exists), then I want to fill up an additional field on the lead in C4C called "Exsting Customer" with the value "Yes". And if the formed was filled in by a new prospect, then this field should be "No".

I can add two "Create Lead" tasks in my campaign flow, and put a Filter live target group on each to split these two cases.

But, I cannot find how to pass the custom field value to C4C. I don't find a way to add a custom field to the "Create Lead" action. 

Is there some way by which I can do this?

entry.title: Re: Charge calculation - FTL - charging configuration by...
entry.content:
Hi, 

even though the case was hopefully solved in the last ten years, I would like to share, what most probably caused the 'multiplication' issue.


In the definition of the Charge Type, there is a checkbox 'Chrge Ty. Grping', when this is NOT checked, it causes this 'multiplication of the correct rate by the number of items considered in the grouping'.

Cheers,

Robert

entry.title: A day in the life of a developer for cloud ERP at SAP TechEd 2025 in Berlin
entry.content:
For me as a developer, TechEd is like being a kid in a candy store. Everywhere I look there are new tools, frameworks, and patterns that I want to try out. The best part is that I do not just hear about them, I actually get to test them in hands-on sessions and discuss them directly with the people who build them.

At TechEd 2025 in Berlin my agenda is packed with sessions where I can dive into code, explore AI-driven capabilities like Joule, and understand how to build scalable extensions for cloud ERP applications.

Day 1

  • 9:30 AM - 9:50 AM CET
    CT1234 | SAP BTP as the foundation for Partner SaaS Solutions
  • 10:00 AM - 12:00 PM CET
    AD162 | Explore Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities
  • 12:30 PM - 2:30 PM CET
    AD169 | Empower your enterprise: Integrate custom AI agents with any system
  • 2:30 PM - 3:15 PM CET
    DT201 | Extensibility with ABAP Cloud and AI in SAP Cloud ERP

Day 2

  • 10:30 AM - 12:30 PM CET:
    DT261 | Build on-stack extensions with ABAP Cloud in SAP Cloud ERP 
  • 1:30 PM - 1:55 PM CET:
    ST118 | The future of enterprise automation: Workflows, Joule skills, and AI agents
  • 2:15 PM - 3:00 PM CET:
    DT200 | Unravel the mysteries of clean core extensions in SAP Cloud ERP Private
  • 3:15 PM - 4:00 PM CET:
    AD100 | Joule for developers: How AI can boost your development in SAP Build
  • 4:15 PM - 5:00 PM CET:
    DT104 | Scalable extensions for SAP Cloud ERP and SAP Cloud ERP Private

Day 3

  • 9:00 AM - 9:25 AM CET:
    ST113 | Journey to unified extensibility in SAP Business Suite and cloud ERP
  • 10:00 AM - 10:45 AM:
    DT105 | SAP Business AI in SAP Cloud ERP with SAP and Accenture
  • 11:30 AM - 1:30 PM CET:
    DT265 | Provision and extend multitenant solutions based on CAP for SAP Cloud ERP

Final thoughts

What I value most about TechEd is that I get to experiment with real code and frameworks that I can immediately take back to my projects. This year‚Äôs agenda gives me everything I want as a developer: ABAP Cloud in action, clean core best practices, and plenty of opportunities to explore how Joule and AI agents can enhance my development work.

When I return from Berlin, I know I will bring back not just notes, but working examples, patterns I can reuse, and new skills that will help me deliver extensions for cloud ERP applications.

Save the date and register today
 November 4-6, 2025 
SAP TechEd Berlin | SAP TechEd Virtual

entry.title: Unlocking Efficiency: New SAP Signavio Content for Agricultural Origination & Trading
entry.content:
SAP Signavio is a cloud-based business process management suite that helps organizations model, analyze, and optimize their operations. Combined with SAP Agricultural Contract Management (which provides powerful tools for managing  commodity contracts, execution, pricing, and risk), this new Signavio content ensures operational excellence in agribusiness via guided business process design.

Overview of Signavio Content for Agribusiness
The new content package delivers 117 detailed process scenarios, spanning across five levels of depth to support both high-level overviews and detailed process analysis. The scenarios cover key areas of agricultural origination and trading, including contract creation, pricing, logistics, settlement, and risk management.

 

This content was built in direct response to a strong demand from our customers, who are increasingly looking for proven best practices and standardized models to accelerate transformation. By providing ready-to-use process maps, the package gives agribusinesses a clear blueprint to align their operations, address inefficiencies, and adopt industry standards.

How to Use It
Customers can access the content directly through the SAP Signavio Process Explorer. Once inside the platform, the agricultural origination and trading scenarios are available for browsing, learning, and adaptation. Teams can use them as reference models, customize them to reflect company-specific processes, or leverage them as a starting point for workshops and transformation initiatives. This makes it easy not only to ‚Äúsee‚Äù how leading practices are structured but also to directly apply them in day-to-day process optimization efforts.

Going forward we plan to deliver the Reference Business Architecture for Agribusiness and subsequently link the Signavio content. 

Benefits
The release of SAP Signavio content for Agricultural Origination & Trading brings substantial benefits:

  1. End-to-End Process Visibility ‚Äì Gain a complete view of agricultural origination and trading workflows, from contract creation to settlement.
  2. Data-Driven Decision Making ‚Äì Use process mining and analytics to identify bottlenecks and improve operational performance.
  3. Enhanced Collaboration ‚Äì Enable cross-functional teams across procurement, trading, logistics, and finance to work together seamlessly.
  4. Faster Process Optimization ‚Äì Leverage pre-built content to accelerate transformation projects and achieve measurable results faster.
  5. Regulatory Compliance & Risk Management ‚Äì Ensure processes are standardized, transparent, and compliant with industry regulations.
  6. Standardized Process Excellence ‚Äì Embed proven best-practice frameworks directly into ACM workflows to drive consistent execution, reduce variability, and sustain long-term operational efficiency.

Summary
With this new release, SAP provides agribusinesses with the tools they need to transform how they manage origination and trading processes. The combination of SAP Signavio and SAP Agricultural Contract Management offers both a clear vision and a practical path forward for driving efficiency, transparency, and resilience in the agricultural supply chain.
Thank you Gabi Weigel and team for this excellent work!

entry.title: How to Integrate SAP AI Core with LangChain Using Generative AI Hub SDK
entry.content:
Japanese version

Introduction

In this blog, you will learn how to use the LangChain wrapper of the Generative AI Hub SDK to call LLMs (such as OpenAI or Google) provided on SAP AI Core from Python.

Note: This guide assumes that your AI Core setup has already been completed.

1. Environment Setup

First, create an AI Core service key from your BTP subaccount.

Then, download the service key.

Check the downloaded file (e.g., ai-core.txt).

Next, store the obtained service key information in a .env file.

In a real development environment, make sure to use .gitignore to avoid committing secrets.

# Configure from the downloaded .txt file
AICORE_BASE_URL={serviceurls.AI_API_URL + '/v2'}
AICORE_CLIENT_ID={clientid}
AICORE_CLIENT_SECRET={clientsecret}
AICORE_AUTH_URL={url}

# Set AI Core resource group
AICORE_RESOURCE_GROUP=default

Note: Make sure to append /v2 at the end of AICORE_BASE_URL.

ex. https://api.ai.***.cfapps.sap.hana.ondemand.com/v2 

2. Install Required Packages

Add the following to your requirements.txt:

generative-ai-hub-sdk[all]
python-dotenv

The generative-ai-hub-sdk[all] package supports LangChain and multiple LLM providers (OpenAI, Amazon, Google, etc.).

Then, install the packages using:

pip install -r requirements.txt

3. Implementation

Once your environment variables and packages are ready, create a main.py file:

from dotenv import load_dotenv
from gen_ai_hub.proxy.langchain.init_models import init_llm
from langchain.prompts import ChatPromptTemplate
from langchain_core.output_parsers import StrOutputParser

def main():
    load_dotenv()

    try:
        prompt = ChatPromptTemplate.from_messages([
            ("system","You are a helpful assistant"), 
            ("user","{input}")
        ])
        llm = init_llm("gpt-4o", max_tokens=300)
        chain = prompt | llm | StrOutputParser()
        response = chain.invoke({"input": "Hello, how are you?"})
        print(f"Response: {response}")

    except Exception as e:
        print(f"Error occurred: {e}")
        return

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

Here, the Generative AI Hub SDK is only used in the init_llm part, while the rest to invoke a LLM is standard LangChain code.

4. Run the Script

To run the script, execute:

python main.py

You should see a response like:
"Hello! I'm here and ready to assist you. How can I help you today?"

Summary

By following these steps, you can quickly call LLMs using the Generative AI Hub SDK and LangChain.

This guide should help you get started with your implementation!

References

  • SAP Cloud SDK for AI (Python)

entry.title: Re: Real-Time Inventory Sync in Composable Storefront wit...

For now, we don't support natively WebStock. And even so, I'm sure it will scale easily and it makes sense for stock data in peak period...

But you could use Angular hydration approach : https://angular.dev/guide/hydration

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_COMMERCE_COMPOSABLE_STOREFRONT/eaef8c61b6d9477daf75bff9ac1b7eb4/f27e70ed630840e59202921c619135e3.html?q=hydration#loio5cfdba27c5834231b13b906eb9d7877f

entry.title: How to use the reject and rework action in Group reporting approval workflow
entry.content:
We have implemented the new approver workflow functionality for group Reporting journals on premise. However, when configuring the exception handling steps with regards to "Reject" and "Rework" the only options to choose from is "Create informational workflow item" or "Do nothing". When using the "Create informational workflow item" action the journal draft is sent back to the submitter, but only as an information. 

How can this be se set up to include the option to make changes to the journal before sending it back for approval? The SAP documentation I found just mentions that its' possible, but not how.

Any help is greatly appreciated.

entry.title: CAP Java: OData V2 Aggregation for SAPUI5 SmartTable (AnalyticalTable)
entry.content:
Hello,

I have a freestyle SAPUI5 application which consumes an OData V2 service which I develop using CAP Java with 

cds-adapter-odata-v2 adapter and my SAPUI5 app has a SmartTable with AnalyticalTable type to use the grouping and aggregation features. The AnalyticalBinding sends a request to the OData service to fetch grand total (aggregated results) of the properties annotated as "measure".

I have a similar application which works fine with CAP Node.js because the Node.js stack can return the aggregated result requested by the AnalyticalBinding.

The request sent by the AnalyticalBinding looks like the following:

/odata/v2/my-service/MyEntitySet?$select=myMeasureProp1&$inlinecount=allpages

I believe CAP Node.js framework interprets this request by checking the "@sap.aggregation.role" annotation and returns the aggregated result (sum in my case). However, CAP Java does not return the aggregated result, instead it returns all the entities individually containing the myMeasureProp1.

Here is an example response of CAP Node.js. It has only a single entity with the aggregated numbers. 

{
   "d":{
      "results":[
         {
            "__metadata":{
               "type":"Reporting.VAnalytics",
               "uri":"https://myhost.com/odata/v2/reporting/VAnalytics(aggregation'{\"key\":{},\"value\":[\"bookingHour\",\"nonApprovedHour\"]}')"
            },
            "bookingHour":"516899.1",
            "nonApprovedHour":"5303",
            "ID__":"aggregation'{\"key\":{},\"value\":[\"bookingHour\",\"nonApprovedHour\"]}'"
         }
      ],
      "__count":"1"
   }
}


I believe Java stack does not interpret the "@sap.aggregation.role" annotation. I checked the documentations and could not find anything useful. 

I'd appreciate any help on how to achieve using SmartTable with AnalyticalTable type consuming an OData V2 service provided by CAP Java.

Annotations:

annotate ReportingCenter.Analytics with @(sap.semantics: 'aggregate');

annotate ReportingCenter.Analytics with {
    employeeTeamID @SAP.aggregation.role: 'dimension';
    employeeID     @SAP.aggregation.role: 'dimension';
    projectID      @SAP.aggregation.role: 'dimension';
    projectTeamID  @SAP.aggregation.role: 'dimension';
    hours          @SAP.aggregation.role: 'measure';
};

annotate ReportingCenter.Analytics with @(UI: {PresentationVariant: {
    $Type         : 'UI.PresentationVariantType',
    Total         : [hours],
    GroupBy       : [
        employeeTeamID,
        employeeID,
        projectID
    ],
    Visualizations: ['@UI.LineItem']
}});

entry.title: What‚Äôs new in Mobile development kit client 25.9
entry.content:
Dear Community,

I am happy to announce that a new release of the Mobile Development Kit (MDK) is now available for all SAP Build (and Mobile Services) customers. You can download it from the SAP Software Center, and also available on the community Download page.

The SAP Mobile Services Client has been updated to version 25.9.0 on both the Google Play Store and the Apple App Store.

SAP Mobile Development Kit enables developers and technical business users to build cross-platform mobile applications. It allows you to build your application once, in an integrated development environment (SAP Business Application Studio / VSCode extension) and run it natively on Mobile (Android & iOS).  

Below UI enhancements are available only on iOS and Android platforms:

  • Support Date Range Selection in Calendar Control
  • Support Event Indicators in Calendar Control
  • Support Read-Only State in FormCell Attachment Control
  • Support Attachment Limit in FormCell Attachment Control
  • Support Required Field Indicators for FormCell Controls
  • Introduce Additional Properties in Timeline Cell Control
  • Support Viewing Password-Protected PDFs in Native File Viewer (Android only)
  • Enable Nested Scrolling on SectionExtension (Android only)

Support Date Range Selection in Calendar Control 

MDK now supports date range selection in the Calendar Section control, in addition to single-date selection. The date range selection displays the calendar in a month-view format and allows multiple months to be shown. Users can scroll vertically through the calendar months. Use this option to enable the selection of a continuous date range.

  • The first date selected becomes the start date of the range.
  • The second date selected becomes the end date of the range.
//excerpt of an MDK page
{
    "Height": 0,
    "EventLoadRange": 1,
    "OnSelectedDateRangeChange": "/MDK2509/Rules/Calendar/OnSelectedDateRangeChange.js",
    "_Type": "Section.Type.Calendar",
    "_Name": "Calendar",
    "Header": {
        "_Type": "SectionCommon.Type.Header",
        "_Name": "SectionCommonTypeHeader0",
        "Caption": "Caption",
        "Items": [{
            "_Type": "SectionHeaderItem.Type.Label",
            "_Name": "SectionHeaderItemTypeLabel0",
            "Title": "Range Selection"
        }]
    },
    "CalendarType": "DateRange",
    "StartDayOfWeek": "Sun",
    "IsPersistentSelection": true
},

Additional Features:  

  • OnSelectedDateRangeChange event: This event is triggered when the selected date range is changed.
  • getSelectedDateRange / setSelectedDateRange APIs: These APIs allow you to get or set selected date range programmatically via CalendarProxy.

Platform Behavior

  • iOS:
    • To modify the selected range, tap any selected date within the range. That date becomes the new end date, and all later dates are deselected.
    • To clear the selection, tap outside the selected range anywhere in the calendar view.
  • Android:
    • Tapping any date‚Äîwhether within or outside the selected range‚Äîwill select that date.

Date Range Selection in Calendar Control on iOS and Android

For more information, refer to the Calendar documentation.

Support Event Indicators in Calendar Control

MDK now supports identifying special events or statuses directly on the calendar. This feature helps users to quickly spot important dates and plan more effectively. Indicators can have customizable appearances and can be assigned statically (via metadata) or dynamically (at runtime), providing an efficient way to manage and view calendar events.

//excerpt of an MDK page
 {
  "_Type": "Section.Type.Calendar",
  "_Name": "Calendar",
  "CalendarType": "Month",
  "StartDayOfWeek": "Sun",
  "IsPersistentSelection": true,
  "Height": 0,
  "EventLoadRange": 1,
  "Indicators": [{
    "_Name": "StartDateIndicator",
    "Icon": "sap-icon://begin",
    "Styles": {
      "Icon": "BlueIndicator"
    },
    "Title": "Start Date"
  }, {
    "_Name": "DueDateIndicator",
    "Icon": "sap-icon://project-definition-triangle-2",
    "Styles": {
      "Icon": "RedIndicator"
    },
    "Title": "Due Date"
  }],
  "Events": "/MDK2509/Rules/Calendar/GetEventData.js"
}

Event Indicator in Calendar Control on iOS and Android

 

For more information, refer to the Event Indicator documentation.

Support Read-Only State in FormCell Attachment Control 

MDK now supports restricting attachment management within a FormCell Attachment control. When disabled, the control automatically hides the Add button as well as the Remove (or delete) option for each attachment.

 

This behavior is controlled via the IsEditable property in the metadata, which accepts a boolean value.

"IsEditable": true

You can control this dynamically at runtime using the setEditable() and getEditable() APIs in a rule.

formcell.setEditable(true)
editable = formcell.getEditable()

Support Attachment Limit in FormCell Attachment Control

  • Maximum File Size: You can also configure the maximum file size (in MB) allowed for each attachment added to the FormCell Attachment control. If not specified, or set to a value less than or equal to 0, no file size limit is enforced.
//excerpt of an MDK page 
{
  "_Type": "Control.Type.FormCell.Attachment",
  "_Name": "InitialLimits",
  "IsEditable": true,
  "MaxAttachments": 2,
  "MaxFileSize": 1,
  "AttachmentActionType": ["AddPhoto", "TakePhoto", "SelectFile"],
  "AttachmentTitle": "Initial Values (%d)"
},‚Äã
  • Maximum Attachment Count: You can now configure FormCell Attachment control to restrict how many attachments a user can upload. Once the specified limit is reached, the control disables the Add button to prevent further uploads.
    In metadata, configure the maximum limit using the MaxAttachments property.
"MaxAttachments": 4‚Äã

Note:

  • If the property is not configured‚Äîor is set to zero or a negative value‚Äîno limit is enforced by default. 
  • Platform behavior: 
    • iOS: The limit is applied directly to the native file picker, which prevents additional file selection once the maximum is reached.
    • Android: The native file picker does not restrict selection. Users may select more files than allowed, but only the first N attachments (where N is the configured limit) are retained after confirmation. 

 

At runtime, you can set or query the limit using the APIs (setMaxAttachments and getMaxAttachments . 

attachment.setMaxAttachments(4);  
maxAttachments = attachment.getMaxAttachments();

Support Required Field Indicators  for FormCell Controls 

This feature allows developers to add a Mandatory Fields Indicator to FormCell controls, indicating that the field must be filled out.

Note: This feature does not enforce the user to fill out the form cell‚Äîit only provides visual indicator that the field is required.

By default, the indicator is a red asterisk (*) placed at the end of the caption. Developers can customize this indicator by specifying a different character in the metadata using the RequiredIndicator property.

  • Only a single character is allowed for customization.
  • If more than one character is defined, the system will revert to using the default indicator. 
  • Additionally, the appearance of the indicator can be styled through metadata.

//excerpt of an MDK page
{
   "Value": "Enter Date",
   "_Type": "Control.Type.FormCell.DatePicker",
   "_Name": "fcDatePicker",
   "RequiredIndicator": true,
   "Caption": "Date Picker",
   "Mode": "Datetime"
 },

The form cells that support this feature include:

  • Attachment Form Cell

  • DatePicker Form Cell
  • DurationPicker Form Cell
  • InlineSignatureCapture Form Cell
  • ListPicker Form Cell
  • Note Form Cell
  • SignatureCapture Form Cell
  • SimpleProperty Form Cell

For more information, see this  documentation.  

Introduce Additional Properties in Timeline Cell Control

With this release, MDK now supports displaying additional text properties‚Äîsuch as StatusText, SubstatusText, and Subattribute‚Äîon the right side of the timeline cell.

 

"StatusText": "Status1"
"SubstatusText": "Status2",
"Subattribute": "Subattribute",

For more information, see this  documentation.  

Support Viewing Password-Protected PDFs in Native File Viewer (Android only)

MDK now supports viewing password-protected PDF files in the native file viewer on Android.

Fiori Dialog box when opening a password protected PDF on Android

Enable Nested Scrolling on SectionExtension (Android only)

In case you're using a Section Extension control for a custom extension implementation and the height of the extension area cannot display the full content, you can use the new IsScrollable property in the Section Extension control to enable nested scrolling within the extension view.  The default setting is false.

Become and SAP MDK Explorer!
Do you have a requirement to build a mobile solution for your enterprise? Take your first steps today by following these tutorials to get started and learn more about the SAP Mobile development kit. We‚Äôre excited to see what you build‚Äîyour feedback and ideas are invaluable!

entry.title: Re: Announcing the SAP Analytics Cloud Home Page Redesign
entry.content:
Hey @MKreitlein 

First sorry for the late answer. and find my answers in Blue.

Why is it not possible to keep the Look & Feel of the old start page in the new layout?

The transition to the new SAC homepage brings a number of enhancements aimed at providing a more modern, intuitive, and efficient user experience. Here are a few reasons why the Look & Feel of the old start page is not carried over to the new layout: Enhanced User Experience, Consistency with Modern UI Standards, Technical Advancements:, Expanded Features

Why must you confuse all SAC users by enforcing the new Home Page?

I understand that changes to familiar interfaces can be disruptive, and I apologize for any confusion or inconvenience caused by the transition to the new SAC homepage. The decision to enforce the new homepage is driven by several important factors like: Long-Term Benefits, Unified Experience, Security and Performance...

You still can set the default view from the homepage settings to Favorites:

thanks a lot for your feedback, feel free always to write me in case you have any wishes or possible enhancements that can be beneficial for the product 

Yours, 

Marouene

entry.title: Re: How to configure email sending in TM Public CLoud
entry.content:
Dear @zsoci ,

First of all I would try to understand why Business Partner (Carrier) does not have email address maintained.
Please verify that it is already done from Business Partner perspective and then try to remove & assign carrier to see the email address of Business Partner.
To see the email address determined for Carrier please open Business Partner tab and check Email field. 
Additionally I would recommend to configure Output Parameter Determination table to have output request item created by default with all required attributes. Usually it is enough to configure Output Type, Receiver, Channel, Email Setting (here you could mock sender address & set email template to TM_TOR_DEFAULT_EMAIL_TEMPLATE), Email recipient (set recipient address), Form template, Output relevance.
So with automatically created Output request item you will be just able to use 'Send to Carrier'.

Best Regards,
Slava Aliakseyevets

entry.title: Re: Picking Quantity Problem
entry.content: I could see from your Delivery screen shot, Warehouse Management is active as some warehouse number is there. Please note in delivery processing with WM/EWM active (i.e. a warehouse number is assigned to the plant/storage location), the Picked Qty field is system‚Äëcontrolled. You cannot enter it manually in the delivery. Instead, picking is executed via Transfer Order (WM) or Warehouse Task (EWM). Once the TO/WT is confirmed, the system automatically updates the Picked Qty in the delivery. This Transfer Order you can create directly from Delivery screen. From top menu bar, click on "Subsequent Functions > Create Transfer Order"

entry.title: Class for each equipment or product cannot be assigned, as there is no template or mass change avail
entry.content:
Hi everyone, If got an issue about classes here is the Problem:

  1. Products are created to be able to record in SAP the equipment that our company maintains (30000 is the order of magnitude). We identified that around 3000 products should be created in order to assign the equipment. But as all the fields from SAP Cloud Public are not enough to classify each product, we defined the classes and the characteristics that are suitable (type:300 different values, brand: 400 different values, model: 3000 different values).
  2. 3000 products are migrated without classes/characteristics.
  3. 30000 equipment are migrated without classes/characteristics.
  4. The classes and characteristics are migrated to classify the products and the equipment.
  5. And here is the problem : the value of each class for each equipment or product cannot be assigned, as there is no template or mass change available in migration cockpit.

Can someone provide me with a solution to this problem?

Best regards 

Simon

entry.title: Re: Assembly Process -Network Marked For Deletion
entry.content:
Follow the below steps to fix the issue

Go to Extras ‚Üí Status management ‚Üí Object status in CN02. Look for DLFL or DLT at header or activity level. If present, remove it (Edit ‚Üí Status ‚Üí Delete flag ‚Üí Reset).

Go to CN08 and ensure the material is assigned to the correct network type and project profile. Delete and re‚Äëcreate the assignment if needed.

Go to CJ91, and verify that the SD/PS assignment indicator is active. Confirm the project profile used matches the coding mask and network type.

In OVZG, confirm that requirement class 212 has Assembly type = 2 (network). Ensure ‚ÄúCreate network‚Äù is ticked.

Finally, if the error persists, run report RCNCT001 (Consistency check for networks) to detect hidden inconsistencies. Sometimes, deleting and re‚Äëcreating the standard network assignment in CN08 resolves the issue.

entry.title: Re: Add Field in SO Form Template datasource
entry.content: Hi Khaing - as Chuma mentioned, You need to consider the Output Parameter Determination settings for the output. Usually, it is set to generate the output on Creation (of sales order in this case) and the output is not regenerated expect under certain conditions. If I recall correctly, one condition that could trigger the output regeneration would be to directly alter the description of one of the sales order items (strangely, change of quantity doesn't trigger it the last time i checked). So you might want to try with a new Sales Order. Let us know how it goes.

entry.title: Trial SAP BTP with Process automation are not maintained with Extract Data (Pre-trained Model)
entry.content:
I am using a trial version of SAP BTP and following the available learning materials for SAP Build Process Automation.

When creating subaccounts in the trial environment, only two regions are available: US East (VA) ‚Äì AWS and Singapore ‚Äì Azure

In US East (VA) ‚Äì AWS, the service SAP Build Process Automation is not listed in the Service Marketplace.
In Singapore ‚Äì Azure, the service SAP Build Process Automation is available and can be enabled.

Therefore, I enabled SAP Build Process Automation in the Singapore ‚Äì Azure region. On the Lobby start page, the template "Create an Invoice Approval Process" is provided: Template link.

I followed all the configuration steps as instructed. However, when testing the block "Extract Data (Pre-trained Model)", which should recognize an Invoice-type PDF, the SAP Desktop Agent shows the following error:

 

irpa_core.error.Error: [requestDoxToken] Error on content received: {"name":"requestDoxToken","tid":28,"code":"InvalidCommand","label":"No bean named 'requestDoxToken' available"
According to the SAP Community discussions, the reason might be that "Extract Data (Pre-trained Model)" only works in specific regions: Australia (Sydney), Europe (Frankfurt), Europe (Frankfurt) EU Access, Japan (Tokyo), US East (VA) (Source: SAP Community Q&A) This means that with a trial account limited to Singapore ‚Äì Azure, the template cannot be fully executed, as the Document Information Extraction Service is not available in this region.

Question:
If trial users are provided with SAP Build Process Automation only in Singapore ‚Äì Azure, why is a template offered that cannot be executed in this region? 

Has anyone else faced this issue in the trial account? Is there a workaround, or is this a known limitation when using SAP Build Process Automation in Singapore ‚Äì Azure?

And how can we offer Build Process Automation subscriptions to customers if their features can‚Äôt even be properly tested in a test environment?

entry.title: Re: MSR_VRM_GR Complete logistical process with goods rec...
entry.content:
In your case, why the checkbox is greyed out is because the option ‚ÄúComplete logistical process with Goods Receipt‚Äù in MSR_VRM_GR is only available for unrestricted stock or ‚Äúnormal‚Äù stock returns. When the material is special stock E (customer order stock), SAP deliberately disables that option because:

  • the stock is tied to a specific sales order item (VBAP/VBEP).
  • the system expects a new goods receipt posting against the replacement PO to re‚Äëestablish the link between the replenished stock and the sales order.
  • Skipping the GR would break the pegging between the sales order requirement and the stock, which is why SAP enforces a fresh inspection/receipt step.

So, in short: with special stock E, you cannot bypass the GR step ‚Äî that‚Äôs why the field is greyed out.

What this means is for sales order stock (E): you must do a replacement PO + GR. The GR is mandatory to re‚Äëassign the stock to the original sales order.

If you want to avoid a second inspection, and if your concern is the inspection lot creation, you can adjust QM control so that the GR against the replacement PO does not trigger a new inspection (e.g. by using a different QM control key or material master setting for returns).

entry.title: Re: Target Value in Inspection Plan/Insp. Lot Based on Ch...
entry.content:
The standard behavior is in SAP QM, inspection plans normally hold static target values and tolerances for each Master Inspection Characteristic (MIC). In Variant Configuration (LO-VC), the sales order carries dynamic values (e.g. Width = 125 mm). By default, the MIC in the inspection plan does not automatically inherit the sales order‚Äôs configured value ‚Äî unless you set up the integration.

To make target values dynamic, SAP provides a way to link class characteristics (used in VC) with inspection characteristics (MICs). The flow is:

Create a class characteristic (CT04)
Same data type/format as your inspection characteristic (numeric, length, decimals). This is the VC characteristic used in the sales order configuration.

Link it to the MIC (QS21 / QS23)
In the MIC, under Additional Data ‚Üí Control Indicators, assign the class characteristic. This creates the bridge between VC and QM.

Assign the MIC in the inspection plan (QP01/QP02)
Use the MIC in your plan as usual. Don‚Äôt hardcode the target value ‚Äî leave it open to be filled dynamically.

Activate the integration as per SAP Note 119708
SAP requires a modification/activation so that the configured value from the sales order is transferred into the inspection lot. This ensures that when the inspection lot is created, the MIC‚Äôs target value is populated with the VC characteristic value (e.g. Width = 125 mm).

So with the above settings, the result would be, when you create a sales order with Width = 125 mm, the inspection lot generated for that order will show Target = 125 mm in the MIC.

entry.title: Re: Tax code and tax jurisdiction codes in ME21N - can yo...
entry.content:
Tax Code (MWSKZ) and Tax Jurisdiction Code (TXJCD) are both determined, but SAP standard does not validate whether the combination is ‚Äúcompatible.‚Äù The system assumes that the tax procedure (e.g. TAXUSJ for US, TAXINN for India) will handle the calculation, but it doesn‚Äôt stop users from combining an invalid tax code with a jurisdiction code.

Why there is no standard validation is because, in standard SAP, tax code drives the condition records in the pricing procedure. Tax jurisdiction code is derived from plant, delivery address, or account assignment (see SAP Note 493515 for details). SAP does not cross‚Äëvalidate the two fields because tax rules differ by country and company, and the ‚Äúcompatibility‚Äù logic is business‚Äëspecific.

If you want to restrict this, try with BAdI ME_PROCESS_PO_CUST (method PROCESS_ITEM or CHECK) to add custom validation. Alternatively, use enhancement MM06E005. In your code, read EKPO-MWSKZ (tax code) and EKPO-TXJCD (tax jurisdiction). Compare against a custom Z‚Äëtable of valid combinations. If invalid, raise an error message (MESSAGE e...) to stop PO save.

entry.title: Creating a Hybrid CAP (Node.js) Profile with PostgreSQL on BTP from Business Application Studio
entry.content:
In this blog post, I‚Äôll walk you through how to configure a hybrid testing profile in a Node.js-based CAP project, using a PostgreSQL database hosted on BTP, and running it locally from Business Application Studio.

While setting up hybrid profiles in CAP is a common task, using them with PostgreSQL on BTP introduces a few challenges, mainly the need to connect via SSH tunneling to access the remote database from your local BAS workspace.

For more information on hybrid testing in CAP: https://cap.cloud.sap/docs/advanced/hybrid-testing 

This blog summarizes the approach I followed to solve a real-world issue raised in the SAP Community (original Q&A here). Thanks to @MioYasutake and @Willem_Pardaens for their help. Worth noting, @MioYasutake has published a great blog covering a complete Java-based CAP example, which you‚Äôll find linked in the answer of this thread.

Table of contents:

  • Prerequisites and Sample Project
  • PostgreSQL specificity on BTP
  • Creating the Hybrid Profile
  • Enable SSH
  • Secure Connection via SSH Tunnel
  • Launch the Application
  • In case of "ResourceRequest timed out" error
  • Conclusion

Prerequisites and Sample Project

In this tutorial, I‚Äôll be using a sample CAP project that was previously created and publicly available on GitHub. If you prefer to start from scratch, you can follow the official setup guide here: https://cap.cloud.sap/docs/guides/deployment/to-cf 

Just make sure to replace HANA Cloud with PostgreSQL by running the following command: 

cds add postgres --for production

Note: The cds add postgres command automatically adds a PostgreSQL resource to your mta.yaml file, using the development service plan by default. However, this plan is not available on BTP trial accounts. If you're using a trial account, simply replace development with trial in the mta.yaml as shown below:

- name: bookshop-postgres
  type: org.cloudfoundry.managed-service
  parameters:
    service: postgresql-db
    service-plan: trial

Once the project is deployed to BTP, you‚Äôll see five service instances created:

  • One instance for authorization (XSUAA)
  • One for the destination service
  • Two related to the HTML5 application repository (host and runtime)
  • And one for the PostgreSQL database

This setup represents a standard CAP deployment on Cloud Foundry with an HTML5 UI module.

Additionally, in your Cloud Foundry space, you will find two deployed applications:

  • One for the PostgreSQL database
  • And another for the backend service of your application (the -srv module)

With the basic configuration set up on BTP, we can now move on to implementing hybrid testing from Business Application Studio.

PostgreSQL specificity on BTP

The PostgreSQL service on BTP is not publicly accessible, even from Business Application Studio. It can only be reached by applications deployed within the same BTP subaccount.

To work around this limitation, we will create an SSH tunnel between Business Application Studio and our Cloud Foundry application.

Creating the Hybrid Profile

To set up the hybrid profile, you need to modify or create the .cdsrc.json (or .cdsrv-private.json) file at the root of your CAP project. This file defines launch profiles and specific options for the cds command.

{
  "cds": {
    "requires": {
      "[hybrid]": {
        "db": {
          "kind": "postgres",
          "credentials": {
            "host": "127.0.0.1",
            "port": 63306,
            "user": "<user>",
            "password": "<password>",
            "database": "<dbname>",
            "sslcert": "-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----\n...\n-----END CERTIFICATE-----",
            "sslrootcert": "-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----\n...\n-----END CERTIFICATE-----"
          },
          "pool": {
            "acquireTimeoutMillis": 2000
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}

Replace the placeholders <user>, <password>, <database>, as well as the <sslcert> and <sslrootcert> fields with the credentials provided by your PostgreSQL instance hosted on BTP.

Direct access to the remote PostgreSQL database is restricted for security reasons. By creating an SSH tunnel, a local port (e.g., 63306) on your BAS environment is securely forwarded to the remote database, so connecting to 127.0.0.1:63306 effectively accesses the remote PostgreSQL instance through this tunnel.

Enable SSH

Before you can connect via SSH to your Cloud Foundry app, you need to enable this feature first by running:

cf enable-ssh bookshop-srv
cf restart bookshop-srv

If you encounter any issues, refer to the official Cloud Foundry SSH documentation: https://docs.cloudfoundry.org/devguide/deploy-apps/ssh-apps.html

Secure Connection via SSH Tunnel

Open a terminal in Business Application Studio and run the following command:

cf ssh -L 63306:<host_from_service_key>:<port_from_service_key> <application_name>

Replace <host_from_service_key> and <port_from_service_key> with the values from your PostgreSQL service key on BTP (create one if it doesn‚Äôt exist). Also replace <application_name> with the name of your Cloud Foundry application (e.g., bookshop-srv).

This command creates an SSH tunnel that forwards local port 63306 to the remote PostgreSQL database through the Cloud Foundry app.

Launch the Application

In a second terminal, run the following command to start your application using the hybrid profile:

cds watch --profile hybrid

You should see a message in the console confirming the connection to PostgreSQL on localhost, for example:

[cds] - connect to db > postgres {
  host: '127.0.0.1',
  port: 63306,
  ...
}

Your application now runs locally in Business Application Studio but using the real data from the PostgreSQL database hosted on your BTP account.

In case of "ResourceRequest timed out" error

If you see the following error: 

<message>ResourceRequest timed out</message>

It likely means that:

  • The SSH tunnel is not active
  • The SSL certificate is not loaded properly
  • The timeout is too short (hence the importance of the acquireTimeoutMillis setting)

Conclusion

Once set up, this configuration lets you develop locally from Business Application Studio while testing your application with real data from PostgreSQL. This way, you avoid redeploying the app after every change and fully leverage CAP‚Äôs hybrid testing capabilities.

entry.title: 2H 2025 Release - OAuth 2.0 & Improved Document Migration for SuccessFactors to OpenText integration
entry.content:
Introduction

This article is intended for customers who currently use or plan to use, either: 

SAP SuccessFactors Extended Enterprise Content Management by OpenText (xECM), or
SAP SuccessFactors Document Management Core by OpenText (Core). 

The 2H 2025 release delivers two important enhancements to SAP SuccessFactors integration with OpenText.

  1. OAuth 2.0 authentication for outbound calls from SuccessFactors to OpenText, and 
  2. Multithreading enhancement for Document Migration to OpenText 

OAuth 2.0 authentication for outbound calls from SuccessFactors to OpenText 

OAuth 2.0 is now available as the authentication method when configuring the Document Management connection from SuccessFactors to OpenText. OAuth 2.0 is an industry-standard authorization protocol that improves security and simplifies integration compared with basic (user ID/password) authentication.

Where to configure

Administrators will find OAuth 2.0 option on the Configure Document Management screen in SuccessFactors when establishing a connection to an OpenText instance.

Recommended approach and migration guidance

  • New implementations: Customers implementing OpenText integration for first time are recommended to adopt OAuth 2.0 from the outset.
  • Existing integrations: Customers currently using User ID/Password (basic authentication) should switch to OAuth 2.0 at their earliest convenience. 

Required steps (high level)

  1. Create a self-signed certificate in SuccessFactors Security Center.
  2. Register the same certificate in the OpenText instance that you plan to connect to.
  3. In the Configure Document Management screen in SuccessFactors, select and use the registered certificate to establish the OAuth 2.0 integration. 

Release and dependency considerations:

  • xECM Customers: OAuth 2.0 support depends on your xECM release version. If your xECM instance is below the required release you must upgrade xECM before switching to OAuth 2.0. Refer to relevant OpenText release-dependency documentation.
  • Deprecation schedule for basic authentication: 
    End of development: November 14, 2025
    End of Maintenance: May 14, 2026 
    Deleted: November 20, 2026
    Full details of deprecation here: Deprecation of Basic Authentication for Integration with Document Management and OpenText 
    Plan your migration accordingly to avoid disruption. 

Certificate rotation and lifecycle

As OAuth 2.0 uses a certificate to authenticate the connection, administrators must manage certificate lifecycle and rotation to prevent service interruptions.

Validity

  • Self-signed certificates created in Security Center can have a maximum validity of three years. 

Expiration Notifications

  • SuccessFactors Security center has the ability to send email notifications prior to certificate expiry.
    Important: Administrators should subscribe to these email notifications to prevent certificate expiration. When subscribed administrators receive email notifications starting 30 days prior to expiry and every week then onwards. 
  • Additionally, the Configure Document Management screen displays the expiration date of the chosen certificate to keep administrators informed. 

Rotation process (recommended approach)

To rotate certificates without interrupting service:

  1. Create a new self-signed certificate in SuccessFactors Security Center. 
  2. Register the new certificate in the OpenText instance in addition to the existing certificate (OpenText supports registering up to two certificates).
  3. In SuccessFactors Configure Document Management, update the integration settings to use the new certificate and re-establish the connection.

Note: As a convention, while registering the certificates in OpenText we recommend appending the newest certificate at the bottom and deleting the oldest (topmost) certificate if there are already two certificates present. This will ensure current and newly created certificates are both valid avoiding any service interruptions. 

References

  • SAP help: Renew Certificate and Maintain OAuth Connection to OpenText
  • Refer to relevant OpenText documentation for steps to be carried out in OpenText for registering the certificate. 

Multithreading enhancement for Document Migration to OpenText 

Overeview

After enabling the OpenText integration, customers must migrate(transfer) existing documents from SuccessFactors native storage to OpenText. The 2H 2025 release introduces parallel processing for the migration job, improving speed and reliability.

Key points

  • No downtime required: Document migration runs in the background and does not require application downtime.
  • Continuous availability: Documents remain available through SuccessFactors application UIs and Manage Documents during and after migration.
  • New uploads: Documents uploaded after integration is enabled are sent directly to OpenText and remain visible in SuccessFactors UIs and Manage Documents.
  • Job frequency and duration: A migration job runs for a maximum of 2 hours and can be scheduled to trigger once every 3 hours.

In the 2H 2025, administrators will find a new field 'Number of Parallel Jobs' on the Job scheduling page in provisioning. This controls the number of parallel threads used by the migration job. The maximum value allowed is 5. 

Recommendations

  • Use parallelization to significantly improve total migration time. The optimal number of parallel jobs depends on your OpenText environment. Work with your OpenText implementation team to select the most suitable value.
  • Note that the job monitor will show one job log entry per job invocation (not per thread). The single log entry will collate statistics across all threads to provide cumulative results for easier monitoring. Example screenshot of job details for one such invocation: 

Monitoring Migration Progress

Previously, it was difficult to get a holistic view of migration progress. With recent updates, use the Check Tool (introduced in 1H 2025) to determine overall migration status. 

How to check progress

  • Use the check ‚ÄúDetermine the status of documents migrated to OpenText,‚Äù located under Document Management Services: Document Migration to OpenText within the Check Tool. This check shows the overall migration progress across the system.

Reference

  • Blog: 1H 2025 Release Update - Improved Document Migration to OpenText

Summary

The 2H 2025 release strengthens the SuccessFactors ‚Üî OpenText integration by:

  • Enabling OAuth 2.0 for a more secure and manageable authentication method; and
  • Adding multithreaded migration control to accelerate and stabilize document migration to OpenText.

Next steps

  • Plan your migration from basic authentication to OAuth 2.0 ahead of the deprecation timeline.
  • Subscribe administrators to Security Center certificate expiry notifications and establish a certificate rotation process.
  • Coordinate with your OpenText implementation team to determine the optimal parallel-job setting for migration.

A downtime for the source system is not required. You only have to consider stopping process chains in SAP BW/4HANA on Premise, empty delta queues before the onPrem BW is moved to PCE (similar doing a BW upgrade) (SAP Note 2548747 - How-To: Cleaning delta queues for upgrade or similar procedures)

entry.title: Re: Stock transfer order return flag (RETPOS) switches sa...
entry.content:
After some investigation of the documentation in SPRO, I mean that this behavior is "as designed".

The Enhanced Store Return can be used w/o activation of "Advanced Returns Management", meaning that you don't need a separate license.

The process makes sense and works.

  1. The sales area in the return PO is determined from the returning plant because this organization creates the return delivery.
  2. The process includes an inbound delivery for the receiving plant (automatically with SPED output type).
  3. So you can use this process with EWM/TM on both sides.
